page.title: 02 Life in the Moorlands
page.content:
The area is dotted with isolated farms, smallholdings and scattered hamlets. The largest villages in the area are Waterhouses where our school is situated,and Cauldon.
Many of the houses belong to families who have lived in the area for generations , working the land and living amicably with families who have come as newcomers to the villages to work in the stone quarries or at the cement works which now dominate the landscape.
Agriculture still plays an important part, being chiefly concerned with milk production and cattle raising.
